metadata.title: CVE-2023-4256 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Within tcpreplay's tcprewrite, a double free vulnerability has beenidentified in the tcpedit_dlt_cleanup() function withinplugins/dlt_plugins.c. This vulnerability can be exploited by supplying aspecifically crafted file to the tcprewrite binary. This flaw enables alocal attacker to initiate a Denial of Service (DoS) attack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4256` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpreplay - 4.3.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tcpreplay package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.4-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
